meanings.definition: The belief that self-interest is the motivating force of all human actions.
meanings.sent1: Her egoism led her to always prioritize her own needs above others.
meanings.sent2: In a world full of egoism, it can be hard to find genuine altruism.
meanings.sent3: His extreme egoism was so comical that it often made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The egoism of the CEO was like a black hole, sucking in all attention and praise.
meanings.sent5: The egoism of the villain made him a memorable character in the story.

meanings.definition: An ethical theory that treats self-interest as the foundation of morality.
meanings.sent1: The philosophy of egoism suggests that acting in self-interest is morally right.
meanings.sent2: Some people criticize egoism for promoting selfishness over compassion.
meanings.sent3: The egoism of the cat, who always claimed the best spot on the couch, amused the family.
meanings.sent4: Her egoism was a shield, protecting her from the emotional demands of others.
meanings.sent5: The egoism of the tree, hoarding all the sunlight for itself, stunted the growth of nearby plants.
